summary.p: Attempts to appease Myconius, who apparently had difficulties with his student Balthasar? Kuchimeister from Zurich.

div.p: I hear, most illustrious man, that your attitude has somewhat changed towards Wolfgang's son. However, I do not know whether what I heard is true or false. Nevertheless, I earnestly beseech you to have the young man recommended to you. He is the son of a very good man, a boy who, I hope, is not entirely bad.
Farewell and consider these things kindly.
To Lord Oswald Myconius, his dearest brother.
